author: costin
msg: Fix (hacky ) for # 157. Thanks to david_m_holmes@reliantenergy.com
finding this bug. The problem was in JSP reloading, with an expensive
read operation executing even when not needed.
For 3.2 we need to document and/or remove all side-effects, and separate
the logic for "outdating" from the compiler.
Submitted by:	david_m_holmes@reliantenergy.com

author: craigmcc
msg: Work around a problem where JSP pages with more than 64k between tags
causes the compilation to crash in writeUTF8.  The fix is to output in
32k chunks.  Thanks to gaborliptak@usa.net for the patch!
Submitted by:	rokicki@cs.stanford.edu

author: costin
msg: Fix #178: use GMT in setting expire time. Thanks meader@hawaii.edu for the fix.
Also, fixed a problem with the logger ( it didn't showed the stack traces ),
and added logging for problems in instantiating the servlet.
Submitted by:	meader@hawaii.edu

author: mandar
msg: selected patches into the tag latest_TOMCAT_30
(fix for the nested compile-time includes)

author: craigmcc
msg: Revise for current "best practices" build.xml design.
Add a "build.bat" script for the sample application, and update the
Unix one to correctly pass the initialization for the tomcat.home
property.
